document.docAuthor: Pešić, Vladimir, Valdecasas, Antonio G. & García-Jimenez, Ricardo
document.docTitle: Torrenticola lukai Pešić, Valdecasas & García-Jimenez, 2012, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Simultaneous evidence for a new species of Torrenticola Piersig, 1896 (Acari, Hydrachnidia) from Montenegro

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Simultaneous evidence for a new species of Torrenticola Piersig, 1896 (Acari, Hydrachnidia) from Montenegro

subSubSection.paragraph:
Torrenticola lundbladi
Pešić, 2004
, nec
K. Viets, 1930

Type material
. Holotype male ( NHMB ), dissected and slide mounted, Montenegro , stream Mrtvıca near village Velje Duboko (
42 ° 46 ' 47 ''N
,
19 ° 16 ' 56 ''E
; 820 m a.s.l.),
13 .viii. 2010
. Paratypes : 9 / 4 /0, same data as holotype , 2 / 2 /0 (mounted); 4 / 1 /0 in voucher collection for molecular study.

Further records. Montenegro : stream Mrtvica near village Mrtvo Duboko (
42 ° 43 'N
19 ° 21 'E
, 600 m a.s.l.),
11 .vii. 1999
, Pešiċ “
Torrenticola lundbladi
” 2 /0/0 (mounted); Komovi Mt., river Opasanica near Opasanica village (
42 ° 40 ' 38 ''N
,
19 ° 32 ' 40 ''E
; 1130 m a.s.l.)
12 .viii. 1998
, Pešiċ “
Torrenticola lundbladi
” 1 /0/0 (mounted); ibid.,
15 .viii. 1999
, Pešiċ “
Torrenticola lundbladi
” 1 / 2 /0 (mounted); stream Bistrica near Crkvine village (
42 ° 48 'N
,
19 ° 27 'E
; 1122 m a.s.l.),
15 .ix. 2004
2 /0/0 (mounted).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 1A–B .
Torrenticola lukai
sp. nov.
, male: A = dorsal shield; B = ventral shield. Scale bar = 100 µm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. Idiosoma large in size (L 850–1050 in males, 1000–1200 in females); shoulder platelets fused to dorsal plate, but suture line visible; area of primary sclerotization of the dorsal plate with two dorsoglandularia; posterior suture line of Cx- 4 partly distinct; postgenital area large; excretory pore and Vgl– 2 posterior to the line of primary sclerotization; distal margins of P- 2 and - 3 without denticles, ventral protuberance of P- 4 unpaired, with one longer, and three shorter hairs; capitular rostrum relatively short and deep (L/H ratio 1.2–1.4 ). Male: median suture line of Cx- 2 + 3 relatively long ( 140–160 , L ratio Cx- 1 /Cx- 2 + 3 2.1–2.5 ), genital field rectangular in shape.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 2A–G .
Torrenticola lukai
sp. nov.
, (A–F male, G female): A = palp, medial view, B = palp, lateral view; C = ejaculatory complex (non-mounted), D = capitulum and chelicera; E = capitulum, F–G = anterodorsal portion of ventral shield. Scale bars = 100 µm.

, L 206 ( 205–260 ); distance genital field–excretory pore 191 ( 175–222 ), genital field–caudal idiosoma margin 278 ( 275–319 ); capitulum (

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 3 .
Torrenticola lukai
sp. nov.
, female: ventral shield. Scale bar = 100 µm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Discussion.
Pešiċ ( 2004 )
reported from northern Montenegro the presence of
Torrenticola lundbladi (
K. Viets, 1930
)
, a species hitherto known only from Spain (
K. Viets 1930
,
Lundblad 1956
). The specimens closely resemble the latter species due to the longer medial suture of Cx- 2 + 3 in male, a similar shape of ejaculatory complex and the rectangular shape of the male genital field (
Pešiċ 2004
). However, from a re-examination of the specimens in question and the study of newly collected material resulted fundamental differences, showing that populations from Montenegro , here described as
T. lukai
sp. nov.
, are not conspecific with
T. lundbladi
. Namely, as showed by
Lundblad ( 1956 )
, and confirmed by our new material from Spain ,
T. lundbladi
clearly differs from the specimens from Montenegro in a longer and more slender capitular rostrum (compare
Figs. 2 D, E
,
9 A, D
with 5 D, F, 9 B–C, E–F). Further differences include the indistinct posterior suture line of Cx- 4 in
T. lundbladi
.

Pešiċ et al. ( 2007 )
stated that the similar shape of ejaculatory complex and rectangular shape of the male genital field of the specimens from Montenegro indicate a close relationship to
Torrenticola lesbica
Di Sabatino & Gerecke, 2003
, described from the island Lesbos, Greece (
Di Sabatino et al. 2003
) and later reported from the Eastern Black Sea coast of Turkey (
Pešiċ et al. 2007
) and Macedonia (
Pešiċ et al. 2007
). The latter species (in the following in the parentheses, data taken from
Di Sabatino et al. 2003
and
Pešiċ et al. 2007
) can be distinguished from
T. lukai
sp. nov.
in a shorter median suture line of Cx- 2 + 3 in males ( 94–100 , L ratio Cx- 1 /Cx- 2 + 3 2.8–3.2 ), and a slightly less enlarged idiosoma in both sexes ( 750–850 in males, 850–950 in females).
